HTMLFormElementSubmit_event.summary: The submit event fires when a form is submitted.

remarks.para: Note that the submit event fires on the <form> element itself, and not on any button or {{HtmlElement('input/submit', '<input type="submit">')}} inside it. However, the which is sent to indicate the form's submit action has been triggered includes a property, which is the button that was invoked to trigger the submit request.

The submit event fires when the user clicks a submit button or presses <kbd>Enter</kbd> while editing a field (e.g. {{HtmlElement('input/text', '<input type="text">')}}) in a form. The event is not sent to the form when calling the method directly.

blockquote.para: Note: Trying to submit a form that does not pass validation triggers an event. In this case, the validation prevents form submission, and thus there is no submit event.
